Author: Dvd1989
Title: [ANN]Capdax Exchange - Sophisticated Trading, Simplified.
Body: On the backend we have made further progress and strides with an eye on our Q4 launch, however we also faced initial challenges in our last tests that has set us back in terms of timing. Our sprint goal is still a Q4 2018 launch, but we want to share a reality of launching in the first weeks of Q1 2019. We are evaluating our product and launch time on an ongoing basis and can only confirm the exact date at a later stage in December 2018. As mentioned in our last road map update, we will still release the open Beta on go live where we welcome the community to give feedback for further user experience enhancements.

Author: Capdax
Title: [ANN]Capdax Exchange - Sophisticated Trading, Simplified.
Body: It's been decided to keep the test phase with a selected small focus group and within our own team. Yes, We are progressing and will release the exchange Q4.  Quote from: lasttime99 on July 11, 2018, 04:24:17 PM I haven‚Äôt forgotten about this question. Currently waiting for a response and will post it once received  Not sure what you are referring to. Please specify your request.   Quote from: nits12 on July 11, 2018, 07:00:29 PM besides a good exchange service, what other tools do this service supports?  Do you mean tools as in features on the exchange or something else? We launch with different user interfaces, easy and expert UI depending on your skills and needs as a trader. We will have margin trading and we will set up an overstaffed support team to ensure that we don't get clogged like most exchanges were back in Nov-Dec-Jan. You can read more about this in the WP. Does this answer your question, or did you refer to something else by stating "tools"?  Quote from: Murile on July 11, 2018, 07:06:12 PM If viewed from the roadmap I think this project is prepared in such a way that the project is successful. and I think this is really a long-term project. good luck   Thank you for your trust and patience!

Author: Capdax
Title: [ANN]Capdax Exchange - Sophisticated Trading, Simplified.
Body: To all participants of the Capdax Crowdsale:  We will be starting the token distribution of XCD tokens soon. Before we get started, we want to address the safety of your tokens.  It‚Äôs come to our attention that a participant‚Äôs email address was hacked and he was unaware of his lack of access to his email account until recently. Please do your due diligence and make sure you are the sole user of all your accounts!  If you lost access to your email, we need you to contact us at support@capdax.com to reset the email and re-do the KYC process to prove your identity prior to token distribution.  We urge you to enable 2FA on your Capdax and email accounts alike!  Thank you for your patience, Be safe, stay tuned!

Author: Capdax
Title: [ANN]Capdax Exchange - Sophisticated Trading, Simplified.
Body: The XCD Token Withdrawal is Live!   Here‚Äôs what you have to do to redeem your tokens:  1. Login to your Capdax dashboard and apply to withdraw by adding the ETH address you‚Äôd like to get your tokens sent to.  2. You will receive a mandatory email confirmation before the withdrawal is processed.  3. Once the email confirmation is finalized, your withdrawal will be processed and the tokens will be sent to your wallet.  Simple as that!

Quote from: zhip on March 28, 2018, 02:22:36 PM when does exchange launch?  Quote from: Leodalat on April 07, 2018, 03:56:28 PM I invested in Capdax cos the Whitepaper convinced me. It's kind of surprising that's completely under the radar - to be fair though most icos are doing bad now. And I want to know when can we see capdax exchange?  Late Q2 2018. That's end of June.   Quote from: zhip on April 05, 2018, 04:18:02 PM Have a few eth in this and concerned by the group size. Coin metro have 15k - what‚Äôs the plan from here? Author: Capdax
Title: [ANN]Capdax Exchange - Sophisticated Trading, Simplified.
Body: The maximum amount of XCD tokens is set to 2,5bn. The circulating supply at the time of distribution will be 51% or 1,275bn. Minus the burned tokens from the crowdsale. We will publish exact numbers shortly.  The remaining XCD is locked up in a vesting scheme with the following specs:  Foundation: 2.5 year lockup with a 10% release every quarter Team: 50% 1 year vesting with quarterly release, 50% released on exchange launch Advisory:  1 year vesting with quarterly release"

Author: geronimo77
Title: [ANN]Capdax Exchange - Sophisticated Trading, Simplified.
Body: I have a question. Before the end of ICO, My XCD was 74124, but It's changed to 50184 now. I am wondering what happened?? I ‡∏¥bought 0.65 ETH with 25%. Could you please let me know the reason??

Author: Capdax
Title: [ANN]Capdax Exchange - Sophisticated Trading, Simplified.
Body: Thank you!!    Quote from: batishta on March 21, 2018, 10:33:03 AM Friends, I just had to write this post. Once again I will thank the manager for help with the procedure KYC. I have not yet met such attention and help from managers on the forum   Glad we could help!    Quote from: geronimo77 on March 22, 2018, 03:22:41 PM I have a question. Before the end of ICO, My XCD was 74124, but It's changed to 50184 now. I am wondering what happened?? I ‡∏¥bought 0.65 ETH with 25%. Could you please let me know the reason??  The formula to calculate the tokens are as follows;  ((ETH * tokens per ETH) * bonus tier)  (0,65*49334,2011)*1,25 = 40084 XCD   50184 XCD equals a crowdsale contribution of 0,81378028... ETH, not 0.65 ETH.  Your numbers are a bit confusing. Would you mind to PM me to follow this up? Thanks!

Title: [ANN]Capdax Exchange - Sophisticated Trading, Simplified.
Body: Capdax has caught my attention, but have questions that will need addressing before i consider contributing.  1. Is there a video interview with /or by the team? (personally this is a must)  2. Does the team have a github to track work progress?  3. Will the team verify their identity (Team KYC) via ICO review websites like ICObench? https://icobench.com/ico/capdax  Thanks

Author: CryptoBlockBits
Title: [ANN]Capdax Exchange - Sophisticated Trading, Simplified.
Body: Just a warning people, Im getting red flags about the CapDax ICO from the project team, By no means FUDding this project for the sake of it, just seeing some warning signs and don't want anyone to be burnt.  i jumped onto their telegram to politely ask this one question.    They immediately buried it with a massive token sale post and then kicked me from the posting on telegram. Just for asking the above question.  I won't be getting in on the sale as its headed (for me personally) from the risky (no team KYC, no team interviews, no github or screenshots of project dev progress) into the very risky (silencing those asking questions).  As always, do your own due diligence.

Author: Capdax
Title: [ANN]Capdax Exchange - Sophisticated Trading, Simplified.
Body: Capdax takes a giant stride forward by adding two key advisors to the advisory board.  We are thrilled to announce our newest additions to the Capdax Advisory Board: Jonathan Ha, the founder and CEO of Red Pulse, and Ku Kay Mok, an investment partner with Gobi Partners and a board member of the Singapore Venture Capital Association (SVCA).  Help us give a warm welcome to our new key additions to the Capdax counsel.        Jonathan Ha  Jonathan Ha is the founder and CEO of Red Pulse, a China market intelligence platform combining traditional research techniques with advanced technology to solve a problem facing all of us today: Information overload. Mr. Ha has a prior background in management consulting, having advised major financial institutions on operations and corporate strategy.        Ku Kay Mok  Ku Kay Mok joined Gobi in 2010 and has invested in over 30 companies, including Aptoide, DeClout, Eko, Hermo, Offpeak, Orami, and Qraved. He is a board member of the Singapore Venture Capital Association (SVCA). Prior to his career with Gobi Partners, Mok held the Vice President position in both Xinya Media and MediaCorp (Singapore).    Stay tuned for more news!

Author: doge_shit666
Title: [ANN]Capdax Exchange - Sophisticated Trading, Simplified.
Body: But in the whitepaper, you guys do estimate the trading volume with the conservative goal of taking 1.5% of the current market share and you even estimate the resulting daily trading fees.   $787,500 per day per the white paper So im just asking how are the token holders share of the fees calculated based on those "estimates".  I dont see anything in the white paper indicating how this is calculated unless im overlooking something.  All it states is "These exchange fees are  distributed proportionally to users holding Capdax Token in their Capdax Exchange wallet." I would be interested in learning more about that specific calculation.

Author: just_strange32
Title: [ANN]Capdax Exchange - Sophisticated Trading, Simplified.
Body: Distribution is a based on new number of users holding funds on the exchange. Even if you calculate the estimated users, you cannot estimate the number of people and what amount they would store on the exchange. XDC is a utility token, distribution of fees is an added incentive but not the tokens function

Author: Capdax
Title: [ANN]Capdax Exchange - Sophisticated Trading, Simplified.
Body: You will find all the information you are looking for at their Linkedin pages. https://www.linkedin.com/in/saaria/ https://www.linkedin.com/in/aaronbichler/     Quote from: usuksobad on February 10, 2018, 02:41:11 AM    These guys ....  Ive been speaking with the community managers in the Telegram about the matter.  We are all entitled to have an opinion. But jumping in TG with 5/6 aggressive oneline-questions and then follow up with  ‚Äòsounds scammy, sounds like a money grab‚Äô before even having your questions answered is pure FUD. It is correct that we do not have a Beta-version ready yet. We will release information when beta testing starts and the ongoing progress.  We do advise anyone participating in any crowdsale to do in dept research. Reading and understanding the Whitepaper is a great start.     Quote from: just_strange32 on February 10, 2018, 03:09:46 AM Quote from: doge_shit666 on February 10, 2018, 03:06:48 AM But in the whitepaper, you guys do estimate the trading volume with the conservative goal of taking 1.5% of the current market share and you even estimate the resulting daily trading fees.   $787,500 per day per the white paper So im just asking how are the token holders share of the fees calculated based on those "estimates".  I dont see anything in the white paper indicating how this is calculated unless im overlooking something.  All it states is "These exchange fees are  distributed proportionally to users holding Capdax Token in their Capdax Exchange wallet." I would be interested in learning more about that specific calculation. Distribution is a based on new number of users holding funds on the exchange. Even if you calculate the estimated users, you cannot estimate the number of people and what amount they would store on the exchange. XDC is a utility token, distribution of fees is an added incentive but not the tokens function  To clarify: Every time a trade occurs, the trading fee will involve the Capdax tokens. Either you use tokens from your wallet to cover the fees, or the fee is taken from the base currency to the XCD market and automatically make a marketbuy. 25% of the trading fees will be gathered in a pool of XCD tokens to be re-distributed to all holders of Capdax tokens on the exchange. This means you can not hold tokens on e.g. MEW and take part in the re-distribution. The amount of the 25% you receive depends on your amount of tokens held on the exchange. For example: If you hold 1% of the total tokens on the exchange, you will get 1% of the redistributed tokens.   You can read about the token functionality in the whitepaper, page 21/22

Author: Capdax
Title: [ANN]Capdax Exchange - Sophisticated Trading, Simplified.
Body: WHY CAPDAX?  The list of problems facing current Cryptocurrency Exchanges is at an all-time high. We‚Äôre here to fix it.   The key problems: lack of user friendliness of exchanges for newcomers as well as seasoned traders, poor customer support, security breaches and stolen funds, slow website speeds and serverdowntime, unclear policies and hidden fees!  The solution: Capdax Exchange. Capdax Exchange addresses the major problems with a head full of steam, creating a unique user-friendly experience for new and experienced traders alike, and aligning ourselves with the most trustworthy, transparent and secure principles in the market.   So why Capdax over other exchanges?  Capdax Exchange is built on a state-of-the-art modern technology stack using best practices   from high performance web application and experienced developers from the financial sector.  We‚Äôve integrated a few key leading-edge tools that you won‚Äôt find on many other exchanges. Easy Mode, Expert Mode and a masterfully inventive Market Research Page are just a few of the tools that will help all our traders simply make better decisions.           Once again, why Capdax?  The innovative token functionality of the Capdax Token (XCD) separates Capdax from all other cryptocurrency exchanges. Built on a state-of-the-art modern technology stack, this leading-edge token model was designed to push the current state of exchange technology to a new level, with the ultimate focus being on you, the USER.   1. Users will be able to buy and sell Capdax Tokens (XCD) on the exchange (XCD/BTC)  2. The unique functionality of the XCD token is that each trading fee must always be paid in XCD tokens and not using the currencies that are being traded.  3. In the case that you do not own XCD tokens or you opt out of using XCD tokens held in your wallet, a market buy order for XCD tokens will be placed against the base currency and XCD will be bought to cover the fees. This will result in healthy and consistent trading of the XCD token.  4. 25% of the trading fees are collected in a pool that will be used as a reward, an incentive for everyone to hold the token on the exchange.          Visit our homepage www.capdax.com Meet the team: medium.com/capdax-exchange   Read our Whitepaper here: Capdax Whitepaper  Come have a chat with us. Telegram: t.me/CapdaxExchange Slack: Capdax.slack.com  Watch our short video explaining what Capdax is all about. Capdax: Sophisticated Trading, Simplified.   Our Capdax Ambassador program is now closed. A special thanks to everyone participating!

Author: Capdax
Title: [ANN]Capdax Exchange - Sophisticated Trading, Simplified.
Body: Reserved

Author: Capdax
Title: [ANN]Capdax Exchange - Sophisticated Trading, Simplified.
Body: The team at Capdax is proud to announce our advisory board, a group of individuals that are renowned for their cryptocurrency and blockchain expertise in relation to software infrastructure, performance marketing, and open source database management.       Colin Charles  Colin Charles was on the founding team of MariaDB, having to growth hack its user-base from constant evangelism almost singlehandedly. He cares deeply about infrastructure software, from Linux, databases and scaling web infrastructure. He was also an early employee at MySQL (till its exit). He is knowledgable about data stores, and straight about community evangelism, developer relations and remote working. In past lives, he also served on FESCO for The Fedora Project and also hacked on OpenOffice.org.        Sean Mulkeen  Sean is a performance marketing industry veteran with ties into blockchain and cryptocurrency dating back to 2013. Sean‚Äôs experience in performance marketing over the last 15 years has helped numerous international businesses grow effectively, manage expectations & become more efficient. He is an avid entrepreneur in several areas of business, with a background in finance from St. Bonaventure University.         Jeffrey Premer  Jeffrey is Managing Director of ICO Capital Management PTE Ltd of Singapore, a next generation cryptocurrency mining and blockchain infrastructure company. He is also Chief Strategy Officer and advisor to the CEO for UK based Isotropic Systems, Ltd., a technology company that is developing the world's first commercial application of transformation optics for millimeter wave RF antennas.         Jonathan Ha  Jonathan Ha is the founder and CEO of Red Pulse, a China market intelligence platform combining traditional research techniques with advanced technology to solve a problem facing all of us today: Information overload. Mr. Ha has a prior background in management consulting, having advised major financial institutions on operations and corporate strategy.        Ku Kay Mok  Ku Kay Mok joined Gobi in 2010 and has invested in over 30 companies, including Aptoide, DeClout, Eko, Hermo, Offpeak, Orami, and Qraved. He is a board member of the Singapore Venture Capital Association (SVCA). Prior to his career with Gobi Partners, Mok held the Vice President position in both Xinya Media and MediaCorp (Singapore).     Read about them at our Medium. Introducing Members to the Capdax Advisory Board   Stay tuned for more news!

Author: Capdax
Title: [ANN]Capdax Exchange - Sophisticated Trading, Simplified.
Body: Glad to hear! Welcome aboard!   Quote from: StuFF981 on January 31, 2018, 04:30:53 AM What other tools you will have on page, except Easy Mode, Expert Modeand a masterfully inventive Market Research?   On top of the tools you stated we will implement Social Trading. A function where you may allow friends and family to mirror your portfolio with a portion of their funds. This will minimize the amount of time you have to spend on contacting them and give a heads up every time you find something interesting to trade. It will also drastically reduce the amount of time the followers have to spend on educating themselves in Crypto. The primary benefit of being a Leader in the Capdax Social Trading program is the extra revenue generated via fees from the Followers.   We will focus on setting a new standard for Support. Easy-to-use ticketing system Fully-staffed and well-trained support team Fast resolution for login/account issues Fast processing of withdrawals  Customer service on current cryptocurrency exchanges is becoming a primary concern as exponential growth leads to an ever larger backlog of issues. User trust is eroded when there is no reasonable expectation that a support ticket will be resolved in a timely manner, especially for time sensitive issues such as fund withdrawals and inaccessible accounts. User funds are often locked up for months without any answer from customer service. In an emergency, timely access to funds is essential, and these issues must be handled as expeditiously as possible.   You will be able to Customize your Market Overview to easily see whats going on at the moment with your crypto, and the trading pairs you noted as interesting.   Also, important to note: Capdax will be an EASY-TO-USE exchange for newcomers in the "Easy mode", while in "Expert mode" we will provide a range of tools to allow seasoned experts the control they need.   For more detailed information I recommend you to read our WP. Link can be found at the top of our ANN.  Glad to see you all around, have a nice day!
